intro: Lysipomia laciniata var. ciliata, commonly known as the ciliate lichenwort, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, thread-like leaves that give it a feathery appearance. This plant typically grows in shallow freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. It is often found in nutrient-rich substrates and can form dense mats on the water surface. The plant plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
